intro: Sonchus albanus, commonly known as Greater Pellitory, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, thriving in temperate climates. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads.
